comment: It's not limited to abuse either. When women commit suicide, their entire circle gets accused and cracked down. But when men have body dysmorphia they get called a narcissist or ungrateful or to "suck it up". And don't even get me started on professional environment too. If you think unequal wage is a women problem, then men also have issues like being made to work overtime more often, or put in more occupational hazard than women, or even receive abuse from customers because they think it's more okay to yell at men. Double standards happen everywhere.

comment:
why do people feel so comfortable saying she's the abuser? I read the articles about this case and even after hearing accounts on both sides I couldn't really tell which one held the most power in that relationship. I honestly don't feel comfortable accusing either of them because both of them describe and admit to doing some form of physical abuse. Why has everyone reached a consensus that she was making things up/was the abuser? This makes me extremely uncomfortable specially because most sources on Depp's side are his friends, his attorneys.

The only conclusion I can come to is that the relationship was extremely unhealthy. But as to say which one of them was the instigator? I wish I knew why people are so sure, specially when no one is ever this sure when a woman makes the accusation.

comment: I agree 100% with you. My brother has been in an abusive relationship for the past 10 years. His girlfriend has hit him, physically blocked him from leaving, stolen his glasses to prevent him from leaving (his eyesight is terrible like mine), ripped his clothes, threatened him with suicide if he leaves. He has told me he had to hide knives, sleep in the hospital parking lot to get away from her etc. Who knows what else. she has alcohol issues, recently lost custody of her son (from her previous marriage) She even threatened him with the ol‚Äô ‚Äúcall the police, who‚Äôs going to believe you?‚Äù My brother is 5‚Äô10 ish and his girlfriend is 5‚Äô2. He doesn‚Äôt want to defend himself because he doesn‚Äôt want to hurt her. The few times he has had to push her away, he feels so bad. ‚ÄúNauseating‚Äù is the word he used. Point is, women abuse too. This Depp/Heard situation triggers me because it hits too close to home. Lost count of all the times my mom and I have cried because of the situation. We are all so close and he didn‚Äôt tell us at first for 6 years. We pray he gets counseling for himself/his reasons and that he finds the courage to leave. I am so glad Johnny is speaking up for himself. Gives me hope. The fact that we think abuse is a woman‚Äôs issue when it‚Äôs nearly even is infuriating.

author: liza c

comment:
I'm a man who was in an abusive relationship for years. When  we broke up one of my friends said to her something like "I really hope he presses charges". 
Because of this she panicked and told the police I was beating HER through the whole relationship just incase I did. Because she was the woman making the claim and I was only a man with evidence, the police put my phone in an evidence locker and "lost" it, so I had no way of proving my innocence. 
I had watertight evidence of her abuse. I never once fought back or laid a finger on her, but just because she said I did with no evidence, I did 6 months in prison when I was the VICTIM. To this day no one has ever really believed me other than people who where around and saw for themselves what she put me through, because of toxic poison like meto and believe all women. It's going to be on my record for the rest of my life that I slapped my wife around when the opposite is true. She got all this mental health help and housing and they fully supported her stopping me seeing my kids, who I haven't seen in 4 years. Whenever I seek help for the PTSD, eating disorder and other mental health issues I came out of that relationship with (I literally got sectioned for it at one point) I'm either greeted with "man up" or "well you shouldnt have beat up your wife". I never even fought back I would just let her hit me, quite often with weapons, because I thought I loved her.
